description: From Middle English furious, from Old French furieus, from Latin furiōsus. Displaced native Old English hātheort (literally “hot-hearted”).

adjectives.description: furious (comparative more furious, superlative most furious)

examples: a furious animal; parent furious at their child's behaviour

entries.meaning: Rushing with impetuosity; moving with violence.
examples: a furious stream; a furious wind or storm
